message:
`RunSynchronously` is actually completely different. It can only be used for [Delegate Tasks](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2014/06/a-tour-of-task-part-3-status.html) and is used to [start the Delegate Task on the current thread](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2015/02/a-tour-of-task-part-8-starting.html). So it *can't* actually be used for a task that is already running, or for any Promise Tasks; if you call it in those scenarios, you'll get an exception.

These days, the only reason to use `RunSynchronously` is if you were writing your own Task Scheduler.
